org.openmap4u.geom

Class Path2DBuilderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmap4u.geom.Path2DBuilderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buildable<java.awt.geom.Path2D.Double>, Plugable, Path2DBuilder<Path2DBuilderImpl>

    public class Path2DBuilderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Path2DBuilder<Path2DBuilderImpl>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path2DBuilderImpl() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Path2DBuilderImpl addPath(T path2DBuilder)
      Adds a path to the current path.
      Path2DBuilderImpl arc(Point position, double radius, double startAngle, double endAngle)
      Adds an arc to the path which is centered at the position with radius starting at startAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).
      Path2DBuilderImpl arcTo(Point controlPoint1, Point controlPoint2, double radiusX, double radiusY, double rotation)
      Adds an arc to the path with the given control points and radius, connected to the previous point by a straight line.
      Path2DBuilderImpl bezierCurveTo(Point controlPoint1, Point controlPoint2, Point toPoint)
      Adds a cubic Bezier curve to the path.
      java.awt.geom.Path2D.Double build()
      Builds the object.
      Path2DBuilderImpl closePath()
      Causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path.
      Path2DBuilderImpl ellipse(Point position, double radiusX, double radiusY)
      Adds an ellipse to the path which is centered at (x, y) position with the radii radiusX and radiusY starting at startAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).
      Path2DBuilderImpl lineTo(Point toPoint)
      Connects the last point in the subpath to the point with a straight line.
      Path2DBuilderImpl moveTo(Point toPoint)
      Moves the starting point of a new sub-path to the position.
      Path2DBuilderImpl quadraticCurveTo(Point controlPoint, Point toPoint)
      Adds a quadratic Bezier curve to the current path.The first point is the control point and the second one is the end point.
      Path2DBuilderImpl rect(Point position, double width, double height)
      Creates a path for a rectangle at position with a size that is determined by width and height.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • closePath

        public Path2DBuilderImpl closePath()
        Description copied from interface: Path2DBuilder
        Causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path. It tries to draw a straight line from the current point to the start. If the shape has already been closed or has only one point, this function does nothing.
        Specified by:
        closePath in interface Path2DBuilder<Path2DBuilderImpl>
        Returns:

      • bezierCurveTo

        public Path2DBuilderImpl bezierCurveTo(Point controlPoint1,
                                       Point controlPoint2,
                                       Point toPoint)
        Description copied from interface: Path2DBuilder
        Adds a cubic Bezier curve to the path. It requires three points. The first two points are control points and the third one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path.
        Specified by:
        bezierCurveTo in interface Path2DBuilder<Path2DBuilderImpl>
        Returns:
        Method chaining pattern.

      • quadraticCurveTo

        public Path2DBuilderImpl quadraticCurveTo(Point controlPoint,
                                          Point toPoint)
        Description copied from interface: Path2DBuilder
        Adds a quadratic Bezier curve to the current path.The first point is the control point and the second one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path.
        Specified by:
        quadraticCurveTo in interface Path2DBuilder<Path2DBuilderImpl>
